body.name: Phomemo Embossing Label Maker with Tape, Vintage Embossed Labeler, Manul Old School Label Printer, Protable Handheld Retro Label Maker with 10 Rolls 3D Embossing Label for Home Office DIY, Green
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 hrs 15 mins
features: Embossing Label Maker - Experience the joy of printing with the most original, retro press. Phomemo Embossing Label Maker requires no batteries or ink cartridges.

Label Maker Using Tips - Please align the "|| ||" symbol on the side before each use and entering spaces at the beginning, at the end, and between characters, pressing and holding for a few seconds and then releasing will make the label more beautiful.

Phomemo Label Maker - Featuring a 48-character dial, it effortlessly prints all capital letters from A to Z, numbers, and common characters for all your daily printing needs. The ergonomically designed flat handle ensures comfortable usage, while the pre-cut ribbon improves ribbon peeling and overall ease of use.

3D Embossing Label Tape - Experience the durability and functionality of our plastic label tape. With a 3D effect, it offers effortless readability while being resistant to water, abrasion, temperature, grease, and fading. Its strong adhesion ensures it sticks easily to most clean surfaces, yet it peels off without leaving any residue. This versatile tape is perfect for both indoor and outdoor use.

Package Includes - You will receive an embossing label maker with 10 embossing label tapes (2*Black/2*Gold/2*Champagne Gold/2*Transparent/2*Silver), start enjoying printing as soon as you receive your package!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Labels for everything
reviews.reviewText: This is a great gift or just for yourself. It's easy to use. Select the letter or symbol you require and squeeze the trigger. It makes the labels quietly and they last a long time. You can lable anything from books, boxes, and jars. You can locate things at a glance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It works when it wants to
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this item really bad. It worked great for a while, but after several uses, it started to get jammed I thought I could fix it by unscrew it and seeing what the problem was however, it’s still gets jammed quite often. I still use it because I am in need of a labeler desperately

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this, I use it in my bullet journal and it works great. Also good for labels

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really disappointed. No matter how much I triple check everything is aligned appropriately, the device will not type the correct letters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY COOL LABEL MAKER!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this Phomemo Embossing Label Maker (in pink) to held me with organizing. So far, it’s been a great help. I remember having one of these back in high school (class of 1983), but I didn’t specifically remember how it worked. Clear concise direction are included as well as 10 rolls of tape (the adhesive backing is excellent). It was super easy to set up so I started with the white tape first. In my image, the tape that is clear, only showing the white lettering, is actually the “white tape.” I was concerned the embossing wouldn’t show up until I removed the backing & realized that white = translucent. It does require some manual force, but once I got the hang of it, making labels became a very easy process.This is constructed out of a very tough plastic. It feels like a good quality tool and it’s very easy to grip. I really like this is a one and done deal. No computer, no charging, everything needed is right at hand. I think this would be great for kids and college students. I plan to hide this when mine comes home for a visit. Or at the price point, if she really wants one, it’s def affordable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Cute, But Frustrating
reviews.reviewText: This is so cute and the good results are also so cute! Getting a good result is super frustrating, though. Took me about 2.5 hours for unboxing and successfully creating labels for 2 bins. I will plan on 30 min per label in the future. Ick.The adhesive seems pretty good, but I was still able to pull it off of plastic to reposition right away.The directions are good and give helpful troubleshooting tips, which is good because I had to do at least one tip between each label.Getting the ribbon tape to feed in the first place is super awkward. I had to push the ribbon into the slot while squeezing the handle multiple times to catch it up in the feeder.The automatic cutter only worked properly twice. It seems like it's supposed to cut jut the ribbon part so it flakes away easily, but everything comes out of the mechanism. (The "DISNET" label in my picture shows the correct cut.) It didn't cut at all sometimes, but more often it cut the tape AND the backing so I had to peel them away from each other with a fingernail. Then I have to fish the tiny slice out of the mechanism. I tried unscrewing/disassembling the whole machine at one point, but it really doesn't come apart. The best I could do was pry the character wheel apart by like 3mm and try to scrape the stuck pieces out. Not very successful.The character wheel has two halves like a sandwich and each can rotate independently of the other. This does help a little with cleaning, but also lets the symbol get out of alignment with what is actually being stamped. Check they're aligned before every label, as it happened to me accidentally once.The wheel clicks into place on each character, but that is not necessarily "centered" on the given character. I got better results holding the wheel in slight tension so the character is dead center in the "sites" of the feeder. (Pic of the V in its natural spot is way off center.)Pull the handle firmly, but don't wiggle it side to side at all, as it makes an inferior print. It'll be rough on your grip strength after a while. Oh and each print makes a LOUD clack sound.As the ribbon feeds through, you can only see the second to last character you printed, so don't stop in the middle of a label and keep careful track of which letter is next.The color difference between gold and champagne gold is quite subtle, pic included.I will probably use this again, but I would rather have one that doesn't need so much coddling, even if it cost a little more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very easy to use vintage looking label maker.
reviews.reviewText: It is so easy to use. Just load in the tape and align it evenly. I give it a blank space click first so it advances and isn't cut so close to the first letter. I also repeat that at the end for the same reason. After a few turns to choose your wording you are finished, cut and attach label. So simple and easy to use. The embossing gives it a nice retro look.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sloppy looking labels
reviews.reviewText: I won't go into a lot of the details as other reviewers already have. I struggled at first and finally got the alignment correct. I got my first roll jammed. Finally I was able to print.Disappointed. The spacing for letters is weird. Some are offset in the vertical. Others have a large space on the sides. I double checked and for whatever reason some letters have larger gaps between them. Overall it looks sloppy. I'll use it for my workshop.
